visible_ingredients.name: Creamy Dressing/Sauce (e.g., aioli or mustard-based mayonnaise)

ingredient_breakdown: High-quality lean beef (e.g., sirloin, tenderloin, eye of round), very thinly sliced
Extra virgin olive oil (likely drizzled over the meat and/or in the sauce)
Lemon juice (for seasoning and/or in the sauce)
Creamy Sauce (potentially contains: mayonnaise base - egg yolk, vegetable oil, lemon juice/vinegar; Dijon mustard; garlic; seasonings)

macronutrients.fats: 35-50g (mostly monounsaturated and saturated fats from olive oil, cheese, and sauce)

micronutrients.vitamins: Vitamin B12, Vitamin K, Vitamin A, Vitamin C, Folate, Niacin
micronutrients.minerals: Iron, Zinc, Calcium, Phosphorus, Selenium, Sodium (can be high)

allergens: Sulfites (if mustard or white wine vinegar is used in the sauce)
additional_notes: This dish is a classic Italian appetizer, typically served chilled.
The meat is served raw, which carries a risk of foodborne illness, especially for vulnerable populations (pregnant women, elderly, immunocompromised individuals).
Nutritional values can vary significantly based on the portion size of beef, the amount of olive oil used, and the specific composition/quantity of the creamy sauce.
High in protein and healthy fats, but can also be high in sodium due to cheese and seasoning.
The quality of ingredients, especially the beef and olive oil, is paramount for the taste and authenticity of Carpaccio.
